node.title: $10m wildlife centre to be haven for native birds
node.description: An environmental group is hoping visitors will flock to a multimillion dollar wildlife centre planned for Inglewood.

node.title: Bob Baffert banned from Santa Anita amid 90-day suspension
node.description: Legendary horse trainer Bob Baffert has been suspended by the California Horse Racing Board effective Monday, as the state regulatory board honors Baffert's 90-day suspension by the Kentucky Racing Commission over the positive medication test by last year's disqualified Kentucky Derby winner Medina Spirit.

node.title: MS-13 gang leader sentenced to life in prison
node.description: Miguel Angel Corea Diaz last year was convicted of multiple charges, including murder and conspiracy to commit murder.

node.title: Sound travels much slower on Mars than on Earth, researchers find
node.description: On Earth, a high-pitched sound might travel 213 feet — but it will travel just 26 feet on Mars.

node.title: Blues too good for Moana Pasifika
node.description: The Blues have defeated Moana Pasifika 46-16 in their Super Rugby Pacific match at Eden Park.

node.title: Australia, India sign trade deal in virtual ceremony
node.description: Australia has formally signed a trade deal with India as the two nations signal an intention to forge closer trade ties.

node.title: Three Waters package funds affirmation of local government - LGNZ
node.description: Three Waters Reform Package grants are recognition of funding constraints on local councils, and backing for local authorities, Local Government NZ says.

node.title: Back to back wins for the Warriors
node.description: The Warriors have kept the Brisbane Broncos scoreless in the second half to win their NRL match 20-6 in Redcliffe.

node.title: Sri Lanka declares emergency after violent protests over economic crisis
node.description: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has declared a nation-wide public emergency following violent protests over the country's worst economic crisis in decades.

node.title: Police launch homicide investigation after South Auckland death
node.description: A homicide investigation has been launched following the death of a man in the South Auckland suburb of Favona overnight.

node.title: What Will Smith's resignation from the Academy means for the actor
node.description: Smith announced his resignation from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Friday – and many were left wondering what it would mean for the actor's future.

node.title: More people gardening and foraging in Canterbury as living costs rise
node.description: Sky-high food prices and a rising cost of living have Cantabrians heading to the garden.

node.title: Super Rugby live updates: Blues v Moana Pasifika
node.description: The Blues will have a rematch with Moana Pasifika tonight at Eden Park following their clash on Tuesday. Follow along all the action with Jamie Wall.

node.title: 'Putin, not Biden' - How Russia's ruler became a rock star to the far right
node.description: Why are some Americans saying they prefer Putin to Biden? How conservative politicians have done an about-face on Russia from the Cold War era.

node.title: Ex-members renew bid to have charity status of Gloriavale trust probed
node.description: The charities regulator has again been asked to investigate the trust behind the reclusive Gloriavale Christian Community.

node.title: Power outage hits Auckland City Hospital
node.description: A patient told RNZ the lights in the emergency department were out for 15 to 20 minutes.

node.title: One dead following serious crash in Otara
node.description: Emergency services are at the scene of a serious two-vehicle crash on Hills Road in the Auckland suburb of Otara.

node.title: Time stands still tonight: daylight saving
node.description: Daylight saving time ends tonight, and Fire and Emergency is reminding people to check the smoke alarms in their houses.

node.title: People around the world try to break through censorship to reach Russians
node.description: In Russia, the government has essentially criminalized the spread of information opposing its own narrative on the war.

node.title: Missing hiker's body found in Los Angeles park with dog by his side
node.description: The dog was alive but emaciated.

node.title: 29 Minnesotans suffer norovirus symptoms after eating raw oysters
node.description: The Minnesota Department of Health says there is high norovirus activity in the state, and most of the cases are connected to the oysters.

node.title: Tushar Atre case: Inside the tech executive's kidnapping & murder
node.description: Would surveillance video help investigators crack the case?

node.title: Biden's $5.8 trillion budget proposal geared toward moderates
node.description: His $5.8 trillion proposal is coming up against the headwinds of a divided Congress, high inflation, low presidential approval ratings and the midterm elections.

node.title: Warring parties in Yemen agree to two-month truce
node.description: President Biden's special envoy for Yemen, Tim Lenderking, urged everyone involved to "take advantage of this truce and drive it forward."

node.title: Pope Francis says he may visit Kyiv, blasts Russia for "savage" war
node.description: He delivered his most pointed and personalized denunciation yet of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Ukrainian president warns that retreating Russian forces are leaving mines
node.description: He said Russian forces were creating "a complete disaster" outside the capital Kyiv.

node.title: Most deaths in Omicron outbreak were of men
node.description: Nearly two-thirds of the people who have died in New Zealand's Omicron outbreak are men, and experts say the science is inconclusive as to why.

node.title: 3x3 basketball rebounds from international disappointment
node.description: New Zealand were the first 3x3 basketball world champions but missing a pinnacle event last year was a blow the successful programme needs to bounce back from. Video

node.title: Things to look out for after Football World Cup draw
node.description: The draw for the Fifa World Cup Qatar 2022 is done and it has thrown out some intriguing fixtures.

node.title: 'People are pretty good in heart' - Meng Foon on race in Aotearoa
node.description: Race Relations Commissioner Meng Foon reflects on two and a half years in the role, and the job he'd like next.
